name: Fieldwork: Vendor Bank Change & Payment Audit
description: Audit workflow to detect and verify changes to vendor bank account details and ensure subsequent payments are legitimate and authorized. Focuses on preventing fraud and business email compromise (BEC).

data.label: Extract Bank Detail Changes
data.description: Extract and identify all vendor bank account modifications within the audit period.
data.instructions: 1. Query the ERP/Vendor Master Data change logs for the audit period.\n2. Filter for changes to 'Bank Account Number', 'IBAN', or 'Routing Number' fields.\n3. Export the list including Vendor ID, Name, User ID of the changer, and timestamp of the change.

data.label: Verify Change Authorization
data.description: Review the supporting documentation and authorization for a sample of bank account changes.
data.instructions: 1. Select a sample of high-value or high-risk vendor bank changes.\n2. Verify the existence of a formal change request form.\n3. Confirm that a secondary internal approval was obtained prior to the change being committed in the system.

data.label: Correlate Payments to Changes
data.description: Identify payments made to vendors following a change in their bank account details.
data.instructions: 1. Join the list of bank changes with the Accounts Payable (AP) payment history.\n2. Identify payments made to the updated bank accounts within 30-60 days of the change.\n3. Flag high-value payments or those made immediately following a change.

data.label: Independent Callback Testing
data.description: Perform independent verification with vendors for high-risk changes.
data.instructions: 1. For flagged changes, contact the vendor using a 'known-good' contact method (e.g., phone number from original contract, not the change request).\n2. Confirm if the bank account change was legitimate and requested by an authorized representative.\n3. Document the callback results.

data.label: Review Segregation of Duties
data.description: Assess Segregation of Duties (SoD) between master data maintenance and payment processing.
data.instructions: 1. Identify the users who performed the bank account changes.\n2. Cross-reference these users with those who authorized the subsequent payments identified in Step 3.\n3. Confirm if any single user had the ability to both change bank details and approve payments.

data.label: Final Audit Reporting
data.description: Consolidate exceptions and findings into a final audit report.
data.instructions: 1. Summarize any unauthorized changes or payments made to incorrect accounts.\n2. Document SoD violations or control gaps in the vendor maintenance process.\n3. Provide recommendations for strengthening the verification process (e.g., mandatory dual-control).
